Be a force for Good!

At Nestlé we touch millions of people’s lives every single day through the work we do and the products we create. This way we are helping to shape a happier, healthier future for individuals and families, for communities and for the planet. Join a dynamic global team of people that want to be a part of something that changes the world in a positive way. A human-centric place to work with amazing opportunities, across 188 countries, to grow, push the boundaries and deliver work with real impact. We recruit people who respect our values, we provide equal opportunities for all, and we protect everyone's privacy. We do not tolerate any form of harassment or discrimination. Our aim is to create workplaces where everyone feels included and able to bring their whole selves to work. This commitment starts at recruitment and continues to the end of the working relationship.

Position snapshot

Nestlé, HO, Greece

Reporting to: Demand & Supply Planning Manager

Undefined period of time contract. act. rate 100%

Position Summary

The Demand Data Scientist uses data and statistical models to develop on a monthly level accurate statistical forecast. The Demand Data Scientist consistently evaluates the performance of the statistical forecast and is actively seeking opportunities for enhancements. Besides, the Demand Data Scientist is closely collaborating with demand planners to receive insights that might impact the performance of the statistical demand plan.

A day in the life…

  • Develop & sustain data models.
  • Generate monthly accurate statistical forecast.
  • Design and implement continuous improvement actions in the forecasting tool.
  • Support the demand planning team at the market on the selection of statistical models by performing all required back-testing activities.
  • Partner with the Demand Planners to collect inputs that can increase the accuracy of the statistical forecast.

What Makes You Successful

  • A bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Supply Chain Management, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or Data Science.
  • A master’s degree or PhD in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or Industrial Engineering.
  • Data science qualification. Deep knowledge on building data & quantitative models for statistical forecasting. Programming skills in languages such as Python and/or SQL.
  • Good understanding of supply chain. Experience in the consumer goods industry or supply chain analytics is a plus.
  • Ideally 2+ years of experience in demand planning statistical modelling (e.g. time series analysis, regression analysis, machine learning algorithms) is a plus.
  • Previous experience with SAS VIYA is a plus.

Why you should apply

  • Join the leading Food & Beverages company in the world with more than 93bio CHF sales and presence in 185 countries. 
  • Be part of a fast-growing organization expanding locally and internationally. 
  • Engage with our people from all over the world and join exciting local or international projects and assignments, constantly pushing boundaries. 
  • Take full advantage of unlimited development opportunities through an extensive physical, virtual and hybrid learning ecosystem, both at local and international level. 
  • Enjoy the wide range of Nestlé benefits such as competitive salary & performance bonus, meal vouchers, comprehensive Pension, Health Care & Life Insurance programs, increased Parental leaves for both caregivers and Baby Support plan, Flexible Work policy, “Bring Your Pet At Work” & Pet Support plan, in-house restaurant and mini market, participation to health and wellness activities and much more.  

A.I.

We are currently implementing an exciting new AI tool that is helping us and you schedule interviews in a more flexible way. Therefore, we kindly ask you to keep an eye on your email (and potentially spam/ junk email inbox), as you can expect an invitation with interview timeslots to choose from. We would also encourage you to say “yes” to receive WhatsApp notifications, as you will also receive the interview invitation here and you will be able to book your interview directly from WhatsApp. As this is new, we welcome any feedback you might have on our new interview scheduling tool. If you have any questions, feel free to contact with us at the email adress HR.Careers@gr.nestle.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

Job Description

We are currently looking for Data Scientist to join our growing Sofia based Analytics Team, established in 2007, as we are expanding our portfolio to support our North America Business.

As a Data Scientist, you will develop and validate robust analytical solutions for diverse clients – this includes ad hoc data analysis as well as development of statistical models for predicting and managing the behavior of consumers, utilizing machine learning techniques to enhance traditional credit risk models and improve predictive accuracy. You will be presenting results and business analysis to senior stakeholders (both internal and external) and support more junior team members in their day to day activities. You will report to Data Modeller-Manager.

What You Will Do


Develop, validate, and maintain credit risk models, including application, behavioral, and collection scoring models
Utilize machine learning techniques to enhance traditional credit risk models and improve predictive accuracy
Work with large, complex datasets to extract insights and build risk assessment frameworks
Evaluate the performance of the trained models and presentation of the results to stakeholders
Produce ad-hoc analysis on the developed models
Work on proof-of-concept projects to support client needs
Maintenance and improvement of the existing model development pipeline
Research and development of new advanced analytics solutions


Qualifications

What you are expected to bring:


3+ years of experience in Data Science role
A degree (BSc level) at a numerical discipline, such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics and econometrics, Physics, etc.
Strong grasp of probability, statistical inference, optimization algorithms, linear algebra, and calculus.
Understanding of how and when to apply key analytical approaches including regression analysis and machine learning
Ability to write near-production-level code in at least one general purpose programming language (e.g. Python, C++)
To learn and understand new technologies
Analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with an enquiring mind
Experience with BI Tools such as Tableau and Power BI will be considered as an advantage.
Fluency in English


Additional Information

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

What You Will Get


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.


Our Social Benefits Package - the way we care for our People

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




Mission and responsibilities:

As a Data Scientist, you will play a role in interpreting and analyzing complex data from various business areas. Your primary focus will be on leveraging advanced analytics techniques to uncover insights, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making processes.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:

Collect and interpret data from various sources within the AWS Datalake to generate actionable insights.
Analyze results from diverse commercial actions to identify opportunities for business optimization, leveraging advanced analytics techniques.
Develop end-to-end Machine Learning models to optimize business processes.
Communicate findings effectively through reports and data visualization tools.
Identify patterns and trends in datasets, automate routine tasks, and focus efforts on analyzing anomalous or unexpected patterns.
Design and implement new data collection and analysis processes tailored to business verticals such as Wealth and new geographic markets.
Locate and propose opportunities for process enhancements to improve efficiency and outcomes.
Develop and implement scripts or dashboards to streamline recurring tasks and support scalability.
Generate comprehensive documentation of all processes to ensure knowledge transfer, easy understanding, and secure backup.




To be successful in the role you must have:

+3 years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics; predictive modelling, and Machine Learning applications.
University or Master’s Degree in Computer Science / Telecom. / Maths / Physics / Industrial engineer.
Strong programming skills for data analytics and Machine Learning/AI.
Strong Python and PySpark skills – knowledge of data management.
Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data.
Familiarity with software development tools such as GitHub.
Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs. Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies.
Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions.
Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow business.
Strong knowledge and/or experience on project management, PMI Certification will be a plus.
Knowledge of the Agile framework.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist (AI)
Description:
AudaCity Capital is a progressive and flourishing prop trading firm, and trading education provider. We are based in London, and at the moment have a team of highly trained properly trading professionals, managing the company’s extensive funds on our City of London based trading floor.

We believe that the only way to be a winner in our industry is to invest heavily in talented people who want to grow with us. We are seeking like-minded professionals to develop their skills and enable them to join our team.

We trade on all major asset classes on multiple exchanges with our own capital and do not handle any client funds or have customers. By becoming a member of the team, you become part of our success.

We are market leaders because we have always had an internal vision to promote a strong entrepreneurial working culture.Our mission statement is to mix a strong base of intellectual capital with state-of-the-art technology, to build for the future.

Our trading has a unique combination of skills, talent, and industry-leading software, which has been produced in-house by the company development department.Strict, Prudent Risk ManagementYou can have guts, but not glory, if you don’t back your trading moves with proper management practices.

That’s why we treat risk management with the utmost seriousness …

The Role

You Will Be Responsible For


Generating IT budget in conjunction with other stake holders.
Managing overall IT operations ranging from infrastructure to application.
Managing day-to-day stakeholder interaction, identifying needs and evaluating solutions.
Working with other internal stakeholders as well as third party vendors to ensure solutions are in line with current & future business requirements.
Writing well-designed, testable and efficient code.
Leading the design, creation, and implementation of a suite of software.
Providing code documentation and other inputs to technical documents.


Ideal Profile


You possess a Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
You have at least 1 year experience, ideally within a IT Manager / IT Director / CTO or Software Architect role.
You have strong communication and interpersonal skills and a solid track record in IT business partnering roles and driving technology initiatives and programmes across the business.
You have working knowledge of AI and Artificial Intelligence
You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data
You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments
You pay strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard


What's on Offer?


Work within a company with a solid track record of success
Join a well known brand within Asset Management
Excellent career development opportunities

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join our Global Commercial Organization’s Digital Merchandising team, where you'll drive data-informed strategies to optimize player engagement, acquisition, and merchandising performance across EA APP, Epic, Steam, Nintendo, Xbox, and PlayStation.




As a Data Scientist, you will analyze trends, build and maintain merchandising performance forecasts, provide strategic recommendations, and shape merchandising performance by working independently while collaborating across teams.




Key Responsibilities:

Merchandising Performance Forecasting

Analyze historical data and player trends to develop accurate performance forecasts based on core KPIs.
Oversee forecasting processes, lead reviews, and prepare insights for senior stakeholders.
Collaborate cross-functionally to align objectives and provide actionable reports.

Performance Analysis & Insights

Conduct in-depth analysis of partner channels (traffic, engagement, conversion rates).
Leverage in-game insights to enhance merchandising strategies and player journeys.
Apply attribution models to measure marketing and merchandising impact.
Address gaps in full-journey metrics with actionable insights.

Channel Strategy Optimization

Evaluate and enhance channel-specific merchandising strategies to drive reach, engagement, and conversions.
Leverage A/B testing and player segmentation to maximize performance.

Data Visualization & Storytelling

Transform complex data into clear, actionable insights for senior leadership.
Build compelling reports and dashboards using Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Communicate the impact of merchandising decisions through strong presentation skills.

Advanced Technical & AI Skills

Deep Learning & Predictive Analytics – Leveraging AI-driven insights to enhance merchandising strategies.
NLP & Text Analytics – Analyzing user reviews, in-game behavior, and store feedback for actionable insights.
Big Data Processing – Hands-on experience with Spark, Databricks, or Snowflake for large-scale data analysis.
API Integration & Automation – Utilizing REST APIs, Python scripting, or JavaScript to optimize analytics workflows.

Project Ownership & Innovation

Lead new projects to enhance merchandising performance, identifying opportunities for improvement.
Develop analytics roadmaps, tools, and processes to propel business growth.







Qualifications

5+ years in analytics, focusing on merchandising, channel performance, or marketing in console gaming or digital platforms.
Strong knowledge of Steam, Xbox, and PlayStation storefronts.
Experience mentoring or managing other analysts.
Proven ability to collaborate within a globally diverse organization.
Proficiency in SQL, R Studio, Python, Excel, and Google Sheets.
Expertise in data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Experience in statistical modelling (e.g., regression, classification) and data engineering (pipelines, blending data sources).
Familiarity with machine learning techniques.
A growth-oriented, proactive mindset with the ability to thrive independently.
Data storytelling & persuasive presentation – Crafting compelling narratives to influence senior leadership.
Agile project management – Experience with JIRA, Confluence, or Scrum for effective project execution. Ownership and end-to-end execution of projects with minimal oversight.
Cross-cultural collaboration – Working efficiently within a globally distributed team with diverse market needs.
Experience with Looker, Airtable, JavaScript for integrating analytics into merchandising workflows represents an advantage.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data & AI, Data Science Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Machine Learning Engineer (Data & AI, Data Science Team)

The team in question is responsible with the development, deployment and monitoring ML/AI models that impact different business areas, such as: Content, Marketplace, Operations, Commercial.

Our role is to provide challenging and suitable projects for data science, infrastructure, data, technologies and to create a safe environment for learning and development. We develop and deploy on-premises and/or on-cloud depending on the project. The trend is towards cloud, development and production, but with yet no deadline. We provide access to Kubernetes cluster with GPU's included, running Docker containers on each task, writing Python and PySpark with internal standards for coding.

What You’ll Have To Do


As Machine Learning Engineer in our team, your role is to formulate and argument a hypothesis, to access, clean and aggregate data, train and interpret models, present the result, get feedback and deploy model in production. This implies collaboration with the team members involved in the process, others machine learning engineers, team lead, product owner, analysts, clients and data teams. It is part of our values to help other team members or other teams in the process. It is a non-negotiable value for us.


What Makes You a Good Fit


In order for you to adapt for the role you need to have appropriate skills for data wrangling with SQL and PySPark, for structured and unstructured data (text), good understanding of ML/AI techniques, such as boosting, transformers and LLM's, on top of strong mathematical and statistical background about mentioned techniques and be able to efficiently write Python code for development and production using versioning control system (Git)
Familiarity with MLOps tools like Kubernetes, Docker, Kubeflow, will make your work and ours a lot easier.


What We’ve Prepared For You


Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
A friendly office. We redesigned our headquarter office to suit our hybrid work model: we doubled the number of meeting rooms and we equipped them with state-of-the-art technology.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

It is part of our values to help other team members or other teams in the process. It is a non-negotiable value for us.

What Makes You a Good Fit

  • In order for you to adapt for the role you need to have appropriate skills for data wrangling with SQL and PySPark, for structured and unstructured data (text), good understanding of ML/AI techniques, such as boosting, transformers and LLM's, on top of strong mathematical and statistical background about mentioned techniques and be able to efficiently write Python code for development and production using versioning control system (Git)
  • Familiarity with MLOps tools like Kubernetes, Docker, Kubeflow, will make your work and ours a lot easier.

What We’ve Prepared For You

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • A friendly office. We redesigned our headquarter office to suit our hybrid work model: we doubled the number of meeting rooms and we equipped them with state-of-the-art technology.

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

NielsenIQ is a consumer intelligence company that delivers the Full View™, the world’s most complete and clear understanding of consumer buying behavior that reveals new pathways to growth. Since 1923, NIQ has moved measurement forward for industries and economies across the globe. We are putting the brightest and most dedicated minds together to accelerate progress. Our diversity brings out the best in each other so we can leave a lasting legacy on the work that we do and the people that we do it with. NielsenIQ offers a range of products and services that leverage Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to provide insights into consumer behavior and market trends. This position opens the opportunity to apply the latest state of the art in AI/ML and data science to global and key strategic projects.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist, you will contribute to develop end-to-end analytic solutions, shaping data and algorithms to deliver accurate and robust Predictive and Prescriptive Analytics. You will work within a cross functional team composed of machine learning engineers, developers and client solution experts.

You will be part of the Global Data Science, a team of 40+ Scientists based in Nuremberg, Kuala Lumpur and Warsaw with diverse backgrounds. Always eager to learn and share experience, the team is a great environment for your self-development.

Your Mission:


Develop end-to-end analytical products
Work with GfK's Point of Sale / Media / third-party data to develop Data Science solutions for implementation and standardization in production environments.
Support the development of end-to-end analytical approaches based on product concepts
Actively share Data Science knowledge within the Technology and Data network
Support the presentation of GfK’s Data Science capabilities in client-facing situations


Responsibilities:


Support the creation of product driven Data Science solutions by closely collaborating with product manager / owner
Contribute to Data Science projects by developing and implementing Data Science & machine learning models that are reproducible, well documented, and follow prescribed coding guidelines
Participate in Communities of Practice
Create and improve methods and tools and contribute to best practices in Data Science
Foster Data Science related knowledge exchange within NIQ


Qualifications

Essential Skills:


Master or PhD degree that reflects strong statistical / mathematical / computer science skills
Solid statistical skills. Either in survey statistics (sampling, non-response adjustments, Bayesian statistics), or econometric modeling (program evaluation, forecasting, economic theory, panel data), or causal inference
Basic knowledge of optimization and / or machine learning algorithms and / or deep learning algorithms
Solid knowledge of Python and the respective development tools / IDEs (e.g. Jupyter, PyCharm)


Desirable Skills:


Solid experience and working knowledge of the constantly evolving Data Science ecosystem and popular machine learning frameworks
First experience with common software engineering practices and framework (version control, testing, agile development / Scrum)
First experience with cloud computing environments (e.g. GCP) and productionizing machine learning models (e.g. expose as REST API, containerization, scalability, performance optimization)


Additional Information


Ability to think creatively in addressing analytical objectives
Ability to fluidly communicate in an English business environment
First relevant work experience (e.g., through internships)
Ability to fluidly communicate in an English business environment


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer
Description:
MISION:




Estamos buscando un ML engineer para colaborar dentro de nuestro equipo de Big Data y Analítica Avanzada en AXA España, actualmente integrado por Data Scientists y ML Engineers. Buscamos personas con gran solidez técnica que tengan ganas de formar parte de un equipo dinámico e innovador apasionado por el desarrollo de soluciones de IA enfocadas a la generación de valor al negocio.




TAREAS / ACTIVIDADES PRINCIPALES:




Como ML Engineer dentro del equipo de Big Data y Analítica Avanzada, serás el encargado de desarrollar soluciones productivas de ML, IA y GenAI optimizando los recursos disponibles en nuestro stack tecnológico según las especificaciones de cada caso de uso. Serás responsable de definir los requisitos técnicos y de datos necesarios para los casos de uso, implementar la preparación de datos y la modelización y/o el uso de LLMs necesario para darles respuesta y asegurar su puesta en producción siguiendo la metodología MLOps en todas las fases del desarrollo de soluciones de IA. Para asegurar el éxito en el desarrollo de soluciones, necesitarás además:




Trabajar mano a mano con los Data Scientists, arquitectos y desarrolladores software involucrados en el desarrollo de casos de uso de IA.
Colaborar en la definición y el desarrollo del despliegue de la metodología MLOps dentro del equipo.
Estar al tanto de todos los avances en el ámbito de la IA y la metodología MLOps para asegurar que mantenemos nuestros flujos y pipelines de desarrollo y ejecución acordes al estado del arte en cuanto a tecnología y buenas prácticas.




PERFIL:




Cualificaciones necesarias:




Licenciatura en matemáticas, estadística, física o ingeniería en informática, telecomunicación (o similares).
+5 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones software.
Dominio en Python.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos Big Data con Spark/PySpark.
Experiencia en ML, Data Science y desarrollo de soluciones de IA generativa.
Experiencia en el desarrollo y despliegue de soluciones siguiendo la metodología MLOps: productivización de código y generación de librerías, despliegue, gestión y monitorización de modelos y procesos de integración continua.
Inglés: Avanzado




Cualificaciones deseables:




Máster en IA, ML, Data Science o equivalente.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos de deep learning y los frameworks asociados (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Experiencia en el uso de frameworks de IA generativa como LangChain o LlamaIndex.
Experiencia en el uso de distintos LLMs tanto propietarios como open source (Llama, OpenAI, Mistral, etc.).
Experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones de IA en Microsoft Azure.
Experiencia en el uso de Databricks.




En AXA promovemos activamente la Diversidad e Inclusión ofreciendo igualdad de oportunidades. Se valorará positivamente la posesión de certificado de Discapacidad.







¿A qué estás esperando? ¡Únete a la familia AXA y contribuye al progreso de la sociedad!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in document analysis, leveraging LLMs (Large Language Models) and rule-based algorithms to extract, process, and analyze structured and unstructured data. You will work on cutting-edge solutions involving Azure Document Intelligence, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and Knowledge Graphs, helping to drive innovation in document automation.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize document analysis applications using LLMs and rule-based techniques.
Process and extract data from PDF, Excel, and Word files.
Implement RAG pipelines to enhance retrieval and reasoning capabilities.
Utilize Azure Document Intelligence for document automation.
Design and maintain Knowledge Graphs for structured data representation.
Build and optimize REST APIs for document processing applications.
Ensure strong coding practices and scalable software development in Python.
Work with SQL databases to store and manage extracted information.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings effectively.

Core Skills & Qualifications

Python (strong programming experience)
SQL & general database knowledge
Experience handling PDF, Excel, and Word files
Familiarity with LLM APIs (OpenAI, etc.)
Expertise in Azure Document Intelligence
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
Knowledge Graphs for structured data modeling
Experience with REST APIs & software development
Strong analytical and communication skills

Nice-to-Have Skills

Databricks experience
Understanding of insurance and cyber topics

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist (AI)
Description:
AudaCity Capital is a progressive and flourishing prop trading firm, and trading education provider. We are based in London, and at the moment have a team of highly trained properly trading professionals, managing the company’s extensive funds on our City of London based trading floor.

We believe that the only way to be a winner in our industry is to invest heavily in talented people who want to grow with us. We are seeking like-minded professionals to develop their skills and enable them to join our team.

We trade on all major asset classes on multiple exchanges with our own capital and do not handle any client funds or have customers. By becoming a member of the team, you become part of our success.

We are market leaders because we have always had an internal vision to promote a strong entrepreneurial working culture.Our mission statement is to mix a strong base of intellectual capital with state-of-the-art technology, to build for the future.

Our trading has a unique combination of skills, talent, and industry-leading software, which has been produced in-house by the company development department.Strict, Prudent Risk ManagementYou can have guts, but not glory, if you don’t back your trading moves with proper management practices.

That’s why we treat risk management with the utmost seriousness …

The Role

You Will Be Responsible For


Generating IT budget in conjunction with other stake holders.
Managing overall IT operations ranging from infrastructure to application.
Managing day-to-day stakeholder interaction, identifying needs and evaluating solutions.
Working with other internal stakeholders as well as third party vendors to ensure solutions are in line with current & future business requirements.
Writing well-designed, testable and efficient code.
Leading the design, creation, and implementation of a suite of software.
Providing code documentation and other inputs to technical documents.


Ideal Profile


You possess a Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
You have at least 1 year experience, ideally within a IT Manager / IT Director / CTO or Software Architect role.
You have strong communication and interpersonal skills and a solid track record in IT business partnering roles and driving technology initiatives and programmes across the business.
You have working knowledge of AI and Artificial Intelligence
You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data
You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments
You pay strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard


What's on Offer?


Work within a company with a solid track record of success
Join a well known brand within Asset Management
Excellent career development opportunities

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
WHY CHOOSE ENECO?

Eneco has the ambition to lead the energy transition. We excel in the complete chain from energy producing assets to serving customers. This integrated approach connects all Eneco employees and enables us to fulfil our mission. You can feel it throughout the whole organisation, and it leads to multidisciplinary innovations such as Toon, e-Mobility and our Virtual Power Plant.




You are going to work at a company large enough to effect real change, within a digital department that has the flexibility to rival a start-up. Our organization is open and brimming with energy. At Eneco, anyone with a sharp mind and a positive and active mindset can contribute to a more sustainable world.




Create data driven innovations, services, and products for the whole company.




In Eneco’s digital data science team you will set up data-driven solutions together with other business units. This means you can work on a wide variety of topics on the commercial and the operational side of Eneco, as well as the integration between those two. On the commercial side, this can mean advising customers on sustainable investments based on energy use and building characteristics. On the operational side, improving efficiency of district heating or implementing predictive maintenance for wind turbines can be your next subjects. As an integrated energy company, Eneco is also always looking for innovative solutions to integrate supply and demand. In all these projects, adding value both for the customer and for Eneco is key.




Energy companies have large amounts of data available to work with, and Eneco is a leader in this field, for example from our smart thermostat Toon. The big question is: how will you leverage this data? Distributed energy generation and changes in energy demand have upended the conventional market for energy. Digital innovations help to align supply and demand and help the customer have a care-free experience; data plays a crucial part in all this.




YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

Identify problems that can be solved using data science and turn those into impactful projects.
Test and develop your ideas through hackathons, prototypes, and pilots all the way up to a working product or service.
Interact with business stakeholders, data analysts, machine learning and data engineers to balance commercial requirements with engineering best practices.
Convey the data science way of working within the organization.
Pragmatic and iterative approach to data science: able to quickly show results to convince the business, rather than wanting to apply the most complex algorithms.




WHAT YOU BRING

You can easily adapt to new environments and situations. You have focus, courage and a “can do” attitude. You use these qualities to obtain the goals that you set for yourself in an ever-changing professional environment.




MSc in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) field.
4+ years of experience working as a data scientist within a company.
Knowledge of common data science techniques, NLP techniques and statistical methods.
Strong oral and written presentation skills in English.
An interest in the energy domain and innovations and a curious mindset.
Ability to independently drive data science projects and to inspire and guide more junior data scientists.
Fluent in Python and SQL, experience with Azure, MLFlow, AirFlow and Databricks is a plus.




WE HAVE A LOT TO OFFER

A gross salary between €68,000.00 - €97,000.00 (annual salary including 8% holiday allowance for a full-time contract), depending on knowledge and experience.
A free spendable flex budget of 14% per on top of your monthly salary, for example to buy extra vacation days or have it paid out.
Public transport card, also privately sustainable on the road, with which you also travel for free in your free time throughout the Netherlands.
Parental leave, good pension scheme and career opportunities.
Hybrid working; you will work 40% in the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide where best to work.
Drive data driven decision making to build innovative digital products
Help Eneco and its customers become climate neutral by 2035




INTERESTED?

Do you see yourself working as a Data Scientist at Eneco and do you dare take up the challenge to extend the leading position of Eneco in the energy transition? Then you should apply for this position!

Show more

  • Pragmatic and iterative approach to data science: able to quickly show results to convince the business, rather than wanting to apply the most complex algorithms.

You can easily adapt to new environments and situations. You have focus, courage and a “can do” attitude. You use these qualities to obtain the goals that you set for yourself in an ever-changing professional environment.


  • MSc in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) field.
  • 4+ years of experience working as a data scientist within a company.
  • Knowledge of common data science techniques, NLP techniques and statistical methods.
  • Strong oral and written presentation skills in English.
  • An interest in the energy domain and innovations and a curious mindset.
  • Ability to independently drive data science projects and to inspire and guide more junior data scientists.
  • Fluent in Python and SQL, experience with Azure, MLFlow, AirFlow and Databricks is a plus.


WE HAVE A LOT TO OFFER

  • A gross salary between €68,000.00 - €97,000.00 (annual salary including 8% holiday allowance for a full-time contract), depending on knowledge and experience.
  • A free spendable flex budget of 14% per on top of your monthly salary, for example to buy extra vacation days or have it paid out.
  • Public transport card, also privately sustainable on the road, with which you also travel for free in your free time throughout the Netherlands.
  • Parental leave, good pension scheme and career opportunities.
  • Hybrid working; you will work 40% in the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide where best to work.
  • Drive data driven decision making to build innovative digital products
  • Help Eneco and its customers become climate neutral by 2035


INTERESTED?

Do you see yourself working as a Data Scientist at Eneco and do you dare take up the challenge to extend the leading position of Eneco in the energy transition? Then you should apply for this position!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

The Machine Learning Engineering (MLE) team in the NIQ Technology & Data department is an international team with colleagues working in Nuremberg, Malaysia, and Warsaw. Our MLEs work with data scientists in research teams and in cross-functional teams that include product experts, data analysts, software engineers, SREs, and front-end developers.

We are using various technologies over the various products and apply state-of-the-art science and machine learning techniques to provide data-driven intelligent solutions for our clients.

The MLE team actively encourages the personal growth of its members by offering continuous learning opportunities. The MLEs at NIQ Technology & Data department have a horizontal function. This will give you the opportunity to work in different product teams where you can gain experience In other business areas, meet new colleagues and become familiar with new methods and technologies.

This is a Warsaw based position (hybrid) - there is no travel required.

Job Description

Mission


Optimize, standardize and implement data science and machine learning solutions at a large scale and in cloud-based environments
Support the development of end-to-end analytical approaches based on product concepts
Work with NIQ’s Point of Sale / third-party data to develop Data Science solutions for implementation and standardization in production environments
Work closely with engineering, bridging the gap between Data Science and software engineers
Screen the market for potential new/innovative Data Science approaches
Actively share Data Science knowledge within our organization
Represent NIQ’s MLE / MLEOps expertise at conferences and workshops


Responsibilities


Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and enhance ML solutions using software engineering best practices
Study and convert data science prototypes to production quality ML Solution
Implement machine learning solutions at a large scale, in on-premises or cloud-based environments
Implement end-to-end management of the model lifecycle using MLOps practices
Create and improve methods and tools and contribute to best practices in the area of Data Science
Foster ML related knowledge exchange within NIQ, especially around code quality and engineering best practices related knowledge exchange within NIQ
Contribute to Communities of Practice
Present NIQ’s MLE / MLEOps expertise at conferences and workshops
Support development of talent and organise required trainings


Qualifications

Qualifications

Essential Skills


Master or Bachelor degree that reflects computer science / engineering and statistical / mathematical skills
Experience in machine learning software development and architectures for machine learning
Solid experience with production-level code quality metrics and working closely with software and testing engineers
Expert skills in Python and the respective Machine Learning ecosystem
Expert skills in working in (big) database environments (RDBMS, Postgres, BigQuery)
Solid statistical skills:
either in survey statistics (sampling, non-response adjustments, Bayesian statistics),
or econometric modelling (program evaluation, forecasting, economic theory, panel data),
or observational causal inference (potential outcomes, structural equation models, instrumental variables)
or experimental design
Typically 3+ years of work experience


Desirable skills


Solid experience with agile development practices
Good to have experience in Machine learning frameworks such as MLflow
Good to have experience or knowledge of kubeflow, Airflow, docker, Kubernetes
Good to have experience in cloud computing environments (AWS, GCP)
Prior experience in pricing, revenue assurance, media consumption patterns is valuable but not mandatory


About You


Ability to think creatively in addressing analytical objectives
Ability to translate and clearly communicate sophisticated analytical information to non-expert stakeholders and clients
Act as a positive role model for the team by having a positive attitude and proactive approach while being approachable team player
Already worked in leadership/mentoring positions or have the passion and ability to do so
Ability to fluidly communicate in an English business environment


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (12-Month Contract, Fully Remote in the EU)




Compensation: $5,000 USD per month (Gross)




Job Overview:

We are seeking a Data Scientist to develop data-powered services that enhance our product, Subito, making it smarter and more intuitive. You will apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques to extract valuable insights from vast datasets. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will design and deploy innovative solutions that optimize user experiences and drive key business metrics.




Key Responsibilities:

Drive data-driven product design by analyzing multiple data sources to generate insights and recommendations.
Develop, train, and deploy Machine Learning models to improve user engagement and optimize business performance.
Leverage diverse datasets (in collaboration with Data Engineers) to uncover patterns and deliver actionable intelligence.
Formulate hypotheses and design experiments to validate and refine model performance in production environments.
Democratize data across the organization by creating automated reports and dashboards for key stakeholders.




Experience & Qualifications:

3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist working with large datasets in production environments.
Strong foundation in applied statistical techniques, model building, and hypothesis testing.
Mastery of Python for data manipulation and ML frameworks (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.), with familiarity in prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Hands-on experience designing, training, and deploying ML models at scale.
Advanced data extraction skills using SQL, Spark, and related technologies.
Familiarity with software development tools (Cloud infrastructure, Git, Docker, etc.) and best practices.
Experience building and optimizing large-scale data pipelines and ETL processes with Spark.
Knowledge of CI/CD for ML, experiment tracking, and model serving (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow).
Git: Proficient in branching, merging, and pull request workflows.
Docker: Experience in containerizing ML solutions for efficient development and deployment.
Ability to lead projects from conception to production with minimal supervision.
Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders.
Advanced English level (written and verbal communication).




Nice to Have:

Terraform: Basic exposure to Infrastructure as Code principles for automating resource provisioning.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

Artefact is a leading global consulting company dedicated to accelerating the adoption of data and AI to positively impact people and organizations. We specialize in data & AI transformation and data marketing to drive tangible business results across the entire enterprise value chain.




Artefact offers the most comprehensive set of data-driven solutions per industry, built on deep data science and cutting-edge AI technologies, delivering AI projects at scale in all industry sectors. From strategy to operations, we offer an end-to-end approach and solutions: data strategy, data quality and governance, data platforms, AI Factory, data-driven customer experience and marketing ROI. Our 1500+ employees operate in 22 countries (Europe, Asia, Americas, Middle East, Africa) and we partner with 1000+ clients, including some of the world’s top 300 brands such as Samsung, L’Oréal, and Sanofi.




Do you want to be at the forefront of helping clients on their digital and data journeys while positioning Artefact as a leader in innovation? Join our forward-thinking team in a rapidly growing environment with ample career advancement opportunities. If you're passionate about technology and data, this is your chance to make an impact!




What You Will Be Doing:

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will play a key role in supporting clients across different industries in their data-driven transformations. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:




Working on exciting data science projects: You will help develop and implement data science solutions that transform clients’ businesses. These include projects in Causal Inference, GenAI (especially using open-source & open-weight LLMs), Forecasting and Optimisation
Collaborating across teams: Work with our creative, strategy, and activation teams to deliver comprehensive services.
Building client relationships: Use your technical skills to help clients enhance their marketing efforts and data strategies.
International exposure: You’ll have opportunities to work on projects with global teams, gaining valuable experience across different markets such as the US, France, Sweden & the UK.




You will also:

Ensure successful and timely delivery of your data Science & ML projects.
Keep your team updated on progress and share achievements.
Work closely with consultants to understand clients' needs and create impactful data science solutions.
Ensure your solutions provide real value to clients and their goals.
Be a strong team player and contribute to shared objectives.




What We Are Looking For

We’re seeking someone who has:




Educational Background: A completed Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, machine learning, mathematics, or related subjects).
Hands-On Experience: Some experience (e.g., internships or working student roles) in data engineering, analytics, or consulting, preferably in a marketing or digital context is considered a plus.
Technical Skills: Knowledge of computer science fundamentals, data processing, algorithms, and data architecture. Experience with tools like Python and SQL is a plus.
Analytical Mindset: A love for working with data to find actionable insights and solve problems.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, comfortable discussing technical and non-technical topics with clients and team members.
Curiosity and Passion: A genuine interest in learning and exploring new technologies and tools in data and AI.




Why You Should Join Us:




Learning and Development: Join a team of passionate Data Scientists and ML Engineers who will support your growth and provide ample learning opportunities.
Culture of Celebration: We pride ourselves on creating a collaborative and fun work environment with regular team events and activities.
Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including a competitive salary, phone & travel reimbursements, remote work allowance, and a Onefit membership discount.
Work-Life Balance: We offer flexibility with a hybrid working environment that lets you balance personal and professional commitments.
Fuel Your Day: Enjoy a healthy and delicious daily lunch from our extensive organic buffet.
Weekly Unwind: Take advantage of our weekly massage sessions to de-stress and relax.
Centrally Located: Our Utrecht office is conveniently situated near the station for easy commuting.
Career Growth Opportunities: We’re committed to your professional development, offering continuous learning and internal promotion opportunities.




Join Us Now and Be Part of the Future:

Artefact is experiencing exciting growth, and this is the perfect time to join our dynamic team and contribute to our success story.

Come join us!

Title: Data Scientist | Lisboa
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


• DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


• DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


• DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term values.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Scientist.


Requirements:

  • Previous professional experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role;
  • Proven knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and text dataset curation;
  • Hands-on experience in coding for real-world data analytics applications;
  • Experience in NLP tasks, such as Text Classification, NER, and Information Retrieval;
  • Experience working with LLMs, OpenAI API (or equivalent), and RAG;
  • Proficiency in Python and ML/DL packages (PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas);
  • Solid mathematical foundations and experience in statistical consultancy;
  • Strong business sense with the ability to quickly understand use cases;
  • Familiarity with data engineering, modeling, and business analysis;
  • Fluency in English;
  • Knowledge of cloud tools such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud (plus);
  • Experience with MLOPs practices (plus).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to catia.carvalho@decskill.com, with the reference “CC/DS”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Scientist (Statistical Analyst)
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




Aim of the Position :

The purpose of this position is to support our cross media measurement in Poland, Ukraine, Adriatic and support the international TAM business across the region. Responsibilities range from BAU reporting, analysis, optimizing the current codebase, lightweight automation, to new product and methodology implementations.

Cooperating with the stakeholders and other Data Science team in the organization. Ensuring analytic and technical support to the clients, supporting client engagement under the Data Science topics.

 

Supporting local Operation teams at data quality control, data validation and process improvement. Contribution to internal DSCI topic related projects. Contribution to audit procedures. Contribution to tender procedures to keep and grow the business footprint of Nielsen.




Responsibilities :
Set up tailor made large scale survey design,  implement and improve sampling and weighting methodologies, establish and improve questionnaire design
Create universe estimation from survey database and / or third party data
Design, implement and  improve methodologies, including multivariable statistical models are applied for :
Data validation and quality control to ensure data quality standards are achieved
Complex trend analyses of linear and nonlinear viewing.
Viewing behavior analysis to detect any abnormality on the trends
Checking extreme viewers to verify the consistency of the behavioral trend
Panel behavior analysis to detect any abnormality on the trends
Recommending design and analyzing the outcome of pilot projects for operational process improvement
Ensure methodologies are fit for purpose and working as intended; troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve when they are not
Coding for
Deploy and maintain scalable, reusable/modular data procedures, and models for analytical, or reporting purposes. 
Automatize regular analyses and data procedures
Develop, implement and maintain good programming standards and practices across our data science and analytics codebases
Communicate research findings
Present to varying audiences, internal and external clients
Data visualization, including building dashboards
Create methodological, product and process documentation
Work with cross-functional teams to productionize, validate, analyze and/or optimize methodologies





Skills :
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative research field, such as computer science, data science, statistics, mathematics, biological/physical sciences, economics, social science.
Outstanding statistical and analytical skills
2+ years research and code development experience in a business setting
Strong proficiency with Python and R / SPSS
Java, Spark, SQL, Unix, git, and AWS (S3 and EC2) + Machine learning fundamentals are advantage
Collaborative code development experience, including version control, unit/integration testing, code review and sharing is advantage
Language skills: Polish and English full professional proficiency. Ukrainian would be an advantage
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent debugging skills
Cooperative and supportive attitude. Curiosity and skepticism. Detailed and precise workload management
Transparency, honesty, including problem communication











Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Show more
HTML:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We're seeking a Data Scientist with a strong background in building document analysis applications using LLMs (OpenAI API) and/or rule-based methods. You'll leverage Python, SQL, handle various document formats, implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs, work with Azure Document Intelligence, and develop REST APIs. Strong coding and communication skills are essential.




Job Description:-

Responsibilities:

Develop document analysis applications using LLMs and/or rules.
Process PDF, Excel, Word files; implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs.
Utilize OpenAI API and Azure Document Intelligence.
Build REST APIs and Python applications with strong coding practices.
Collaborate and communicate effectively.

Qualifications:

Strong Python and SQL skills.
Experience with LLMs (OpenAI API), RAG, and document handling.
Software development experience with REST APIs.
Good communication skills.

Nice to Have: Databricks, insurance/cyber knowledge.




About Us:

Ascendion is a global, leading provider of AI-first software engineering services, delivering transformative solutions across North America, APAC, and Europe. We are headquartered in New Jersey. We combine technology and talent to deliver tech debt relief, improve engineering productivity solutions, and accelerate time to value, driving our clients’ digital journeys with efficiency and velocity. Guided by our “Engineering to the power of AI” [EngineeringAI] methodology, we integrate AI into software engineering, enterprise operations, and talent orchestration, to address critical challenges of trust, speed, and capital. For more information, please go to www.ascendion.com




With Ascendion (www.ascendion.com), you:

Will get to work on numerous challenging and exciting projects on our various offerings including Salesforce, AI/Data Science, Generative AI/ML, Automation, Cloud Enterprise and Product/Platform Engineering.
At Ascendion you have high chances of project extension or redeployment to other clients.
Additionally, you can also share CV of anyone you know. We have a referral policy in place.

Title: Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność analityki biznesowej
Description:
Nazwa jednostki organizacyjnej


ZUS Oddział w Pile


Nazwa komórki organizacyjnej


Departament Statystyki i Prognoz Aktuarialnych


Miejsce pracy


ZUS Oddział w Pile

ul. Dr. Drygasa 7, 64-920 Piła


Województwo


wielkopolskie


Nazwa stanowiska


Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność analityki biznesowej


Zadania


Zadania


gromadzić, rejestrować, analizować i nadzorować realizację wymagań użytkowników w zakresie tworzenia i rozwoju systemów i narzędzi Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych w ZUS.
odpowiadać za analizę potrzeb biznesowych z obszaru analityki danych oraz ich specyfikację w formie realizowalnych wymagań dla systemów informatycznych w ramach przygotowywanych i realizowanych projektów.
utrzymywać portfel potrzeb i projektów w obszarze Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych .
brać udział w realizacji projektów informatycznych związanych z rozwojem środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych.
uczestniczyć w pracach wdrożeniowych i testowych w obszarze Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych.
proponować usprawnienia dla realizowanych procesów i zmiany w dokumentacji.
uczestniczyć w przygotowaniu planu rozwoju (roadmapy) dla środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych.
Wymagania


Wymagania Niezbędne


wykształcenie wyższe
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 1 rok (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)
staż pracy ogółem minimum 2 lata


Mile Widziane


wykształcenie wyższe (matematyka, informatyka, statystyka)
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 2 lata (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)


Wymagania Dodatkowe


umiejętność obsługi programów MS Office
wiedza z zakresu dobrych praktyk zbierania wymagań biznesowych
orientacja na cel
orientacja na jakość
komunikacja
współpraca
elastyczność
nastawienie na rozwój
negocjowanie i wywieranie wpływu
podejmowanie decyzji
umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów
innowacyjność


Wymagane Dokumenty


CV
listu motywacyjnego
skan dokumentów potwierdzających wykształcenie
skan dokumentów potwierdzających wymagane doświadczenie zawodowe
skan świadectw pracy dokumentujących wymagany staż pracy lub zaświadczenie o zatrudnieniu zawierające okresy zatrudnienia, w przypadku pozostania w stosunku pracy


Dokumenty należy przesyłać poprzez formularz aplikacyjny 'Aplikuj', znajdujący się na dole oferty

Dodatkowe Informacje


proces rekrutacji obejmować będzie rozmowę kwalifikacyjną (przeprowadzoną w formie zdalnej przez komunikator internetowy - wywiad on-line) lub stacjonarnie
skontaktujemy się tylko z kandydatami spełniającymi wymagania formalne
oferty niekompletne tj. niezawierające skanu, któregokolwiek wymaganego dokumentu nie będą rozpatrywane
oferty przesłane po terminie nie będą rozpatrywane
miejscem świadczenia pracy będzie Centrala ZUS lub dowolny Oddział ZUS
możliwość pracy w trybie stacjonarnym, zdalnym lub hybrydowym.
Termin, do którego należy składać dokumenty


12-02-2025


Oferujemy


Oferujemy


stabilne zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę
możliwość rozwoju zawodowego
bogaty pakiet świadczeń socjalnych
system premiowy


Zakład Ubezpieczeń Społecznych jest pracodawcą przyjaznym osobom z niepełnosprawnościami. Stwarza pracownikom optymalne środowisko pracy, uwzględniając ich potrzeby. Istnieje możliwość dostosowania stanowiska pracy i jego wyposażenia do indywidualnych potrzeb osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Wyposażenie Stanowiska Pracy


sprzęt komputerowy,
sprzęt biurowy.


Warunki Wykonywania Pracy


spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,
polegają na obsłudze komputera powyżej 4 godzin na dobę,
konieczność poruszania się po całym obiekcie,
konieczność wykonywania pracy poza biurem,
konieczność odbywania podróży służbowych,
budynek 3-piętrowy z windą oraz pomieszczeniami sanitarnymi dostosowanymi do potrzeb osób niepełnosprawnych,
stanowisko pracy zlokalizowane w pomieszczeniach biurowych na 3- piętrze,
miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,
w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie wejścia do budynku znajdują się miejsca parkingowe dla osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
Data Scientist Intern




Alkemy è una società internazionale specializzata nell’evoluzione del modello di business di grandi e medie aziende e una public company quotata sul mercato MTA STAR di Borsa Italiana.

La nostra mission è di migliorare la posizione di mercato e la competitività delle grandi e medie aziende stimolando l’evoluzione del modello di business in coerenza con l’innovazione tecnologica e i comportamenti dei consumatori. Grazie a un team di oltre 1000 persone, integriamo competenze nelle aree di Strategy, Communication, Design, Performance, Technology, Insights & Analytics con un’offerta, pensata per il contesto post-digital, che copre l’intera catena del valore dalla strategia all’implementazione.




IL RUOLO




Per il potenziamento dell’area di Data & Analytics (former Nunatac SpA), Alkemy è alla ricerca di un Neolaureati e Laureandi da inserire come Data Scientist Intern. La Mission di questa area è di accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di crescita, aiutandole a fondare la propria strategia sui dati e sulla conoscenza che da essi deriva. È composta da Data Scientists e Data Engineers che formano un team dinamico, informale e rigoroso al lavoro su applicazioni di Advanced Analytics innovative e di valore.

Lavorare nell’area Data & Analytics significa affrontare tutte le sfide legate all'uso di metodi quantitativi, dalle tecniche statistiche consolidate agli approcci pionieristici di Machine Learning e Deep Learning applicati ai Big Data, per ottenere un impatto reale sul business dei nostri clienti. Siamo in continua crescita e cerchiamo nuove persone che sappiano combinare le competenze tecniche con la visione, l'intraprendenza e la passione per i dati.




Sede di lavoro: Milano

Esperienza: Neolaureati o laureandi (meno di 6 mesi dalla prova finale)

Area: Data & Analytics




REQUISITI NECESSARI




Laurea in ambito scientifico (statistica, matematica, fisica, economia. informatica)
Forte interesse in ambito gestione ed analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning
Curiosità e proattività
Ottima capacità di lavorare in gruppo
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese




NICE TO HAVE




Conoscenza di SQL e, anche base, del mondo SAS, R e Python




Stage retribuito finalizzato all'inserimento in Azienda.




COSA OFFRIAMO




In Alkemy ci impegniamo costantemente nel creare le migliori condizioni affinché tutte le nostre persone sentano di poter esprimere al meglio il proprio valore ed il proprio talento - e possano sentire Alkemy come casa propria - indipendentemente da genere, età, nazionalità, orientamento sessuale e religioso.

Siamo da sempre profondamente convinti che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo che valorizzi tutte le diversità sia non solo un imperativo valoriale, ma un fattore critico di successo per il nostro business. Aggreghiamo sotto lo stesso tetto persone con professionalità e background molto diversi e da sempre promuoviamo una cultura di condivisione e crescita continua.

Eccellenza, Passione, Integrità e Concretezza sono i valori fondanti di Alkemy, che tutti noi condividiamo e che ci guidano nel realizzare la nostra mission. I valori Alkemy definiscono la nostra identità e sono alla base della nostra cultura organizzativa, indirizzano i nostri comportamenti nei confronti di tutte le nostre persone e dei nostri clienti, costruendo evolutivamente il nostro approccio al business.

I profili ritenuti in linea verranno contattati entro 20 giorni. Non saranno valutate candidature sprovviste di cv completo allegato. I dati dei candidati verranno trattati ai sensi dell’Informativa Privacy sempre consultabile sul nostro sito.alkemy.com
